Hi Amy,

You are right to some extend. As this is a beginners course, every student comes in with a different mind set.

For students like yourself, I have about 79 exercises (along with the ones we do in the lecture), 30 quiz items and 3 real world example. Which you can pause the video and do it yourself. Refer to the video only when needed. 

I hope that as you go further in the lecture you will see how the lectures are laid down. I hope that should also get me the remaining 3 stars. :-)

Please feel free to ask me any questions you may have in the Q&A section or message me. I will be very happy to help.

Happy Learning!

results.content: Great course the problem is the Projects. They are non-existent , the two project at the end of the course are kind of a joke. I had a lot of fun learning with Abhay, but all the time he simply asks people to go and play with the provided file on jsbin.  Which does not really reinforce the materials you have learned. For example after teaching Object methods, there should be a project to that you have to make using the learned material. This course can use about 10 more projects, all spread out to reinforce more information than just document.getElementById();. With the projects added this could be a 5 star solid course.
